items.title: Data Application Engineer at Strong Analytics (Chicago, IL) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Industry: Big Data, Data Science, Machine Learning
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Strong Analytics is seeking an application and data engineer to collaborate with our team on developing machine learning and Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) data pipelines, building RESTful APIs to trained statistical models, and deploying real-time streaming applications for continuous data processing.

This role is focused on applying and embedding machine learning solutions crafted by our team of PhD-trained data scientists. As such, it does not require deep expertise in machine learning or statistics, but rather a broad expertise in ingesting, storing, and analyzing data at scale.

To be eligible for this role, it is expected that you have experience:

  • Building and deploying Python applications to cloud-based infrastructures (e.g., AWS).
  • Writing complex SQL queries for a variety of data stores (e.g., Postgres, MySQL, Redshift).
  • Deploying (not necessarily designing/testing) machine learning pipelines and statistical models using one or more libraries, such as Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, scikit-learn, or XGBoost.
  • Designing distributed applications that use workers and queues to manage asynchronous tasks.
  • Designing and building RESTful APIs.
  • Managing *nix servers via the terminal.
  • Managing and monitoring scheduled/batch jobs.
  • Writing unit tests.
  • Using continuous integration.
  • Collaborating via Git.

Ideally, you would also have experience (or an aptitude to learn about):

  • Building Apache Spark applications to analyze and learn from data at scale.
  • Building and deploying streaming applications (e.g., Spark Streaming, Akka Streams).
  • Deploying applications powered by Hadoop and/or other services provided by AWS EMR.

You do not need a PhD (or any formal education, for that matter) for this role. Applicants will be evaluated first-and-foremost on their experience and skill in the areas described above.

You should have the ability to travel infrequently (<5% of your time) for team meetups and conferences.

Remote or On-Site

This position offers 100% remote work for candidates outside the Chicago area with exceptional communication and remote collaboration skills. Candidates in the Chicago area who can work in-person with our team are preferred.

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary
  • Profit sharing or equity, based on experience
  • Health insurance
  • Generous vacation policy
  • Flexible work-from-home policy
  • Company-issued MacBook Pro's

About Strong Analytics

We are a team of PhD-trained data scientists with expertise in machine learning, research and analytics, and deploying data-driven applications at scale.

We help organizations of all sizes — from new startups to Fortune 500 enterprise firms — tackle challenging analytics and machine learning projects. We help them frame their problems, design end-to-end solutions, and deploy/monitor analytics dashboards and machine learning pipelines that optimize their operations and help them build smarter products.

We are always working on new projects in a variety of industries, including the automotive, pharmaceutical, engineering, healthcare, SaaS, and consumer apps spaces. This leads to a fast-paced, learning-focused environment where we are always learning new things in collaboration with our team (and our clients' teams) in order to provide state-of-the-art solutions that work for our clients.

Benefits

Small, fun team of experts
Focus on continued learning, development, and growth
Generous vacation policy
Flexible work-from-home policy
Competitive salaries and health insurance benefits
Path to partnership through profit sharing and equity

items.title: Senior Data Engineer Work with SnowFlake! at HubSpot (Cambridge, MA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Industry: B2B Sales, Cloud Services, Marketing Software
Company size: 1k-5k people
Company type: Public

Job description

HubSpot’s Data Engineering team sits within our Business Enablement function and is responsible for our central, enterprise data pipeline, data warehousing infrastructure, and business intelligence tooling. We aim to provide scalable, reliable systems that our data analysts and other developers can use easily and sustainably.

Data Engineering is a close partner to our Business Intelligence team, which is chartered with making HubSpot smarter through enabling an ever-deeper understanding of our customers.

We’re looking for a senior data engineer to help us build world class data pipelines and warehouses to be ready for the company’s next phase of growth and our BI program’s next chapter. This is a mission critical dependency for all of our strategic data initiatives. We want to help analysts and users access and get value from data while minimizing the impact of any operational or system issues.

As part of our Data Engineering team, you will have the opportunity to lead the effort on building a modern, sophisticated data pipeline with hyper fast and hyper reliable performance, auto-scaling resource management, low latency, quality assurance, and orchestrated transformations.

Here’s what we expect strong candidates to bring to the table:

  • Top decile skills and experience in the data domain. We aren’t overly concerned with specific technologies, though we expect top decile professionals to know the industry, how it’s evolving, best practices, and what tools are good fits for what jobs. We want somebody to spend their time ramping up on our use cases, not the tech.
  • A significant amount of experience in a Senior or Lead role where you’ve been the decision maker for major architectural decisions around the kinds of data pipelines we want to build.
  • Strong Java development experience of data ingestion systems and data pipelines
  • A desire, and level of comfort, in working on mission critical projects from start to finish.
  • Exceptional communication and collaboration skills.

_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

HubSpot is the world’s leading inbound marketing and sales platform.  Over 18,000 customers in more than 90 countries use HubSpot’s software, services, and support to transform the way they attract, engage, and delight customers.

A global company with offices in Cambridge, MA, Portsmouth, NH, Dublin, Ireland, Sydney, Australia, Singapore, Tokyo, and soon to be Berlin, HubSpot transforms how organizations market and sell. Through its unique approach to company culture, HubSpot has also redefined how people work and live. Our commitment to autonomy, flexibility, and transparency prompted the creation of our Culture Code, which has gone viral, amassing more than 2M views. Ensuring that our customers and employees are continually growing and learning has helped make HubSpot a Best Place to Work in the eyes of Glassdoor, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc. The Boston Globe, and the Boston Business Journal. 

If you are looking for a place where you’ll tackle big problems alongside some of the most talented and dynamic people you’ve ever worked with, HubSpot might just be the place for you. Join us! #inboundjobs

_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

About HubSpot

HubSpot is on a mission to help businesses grow globally. Thousands of customers worldwide use HubSpot inbound marketing and sales software to transform the way they attract, engage, and delight customers. Through its unique approach to company culture, HubSpot has also redefined how people work and live. Our commitment to autonomy, flexibility, and transparency prompted the creation of our Culture Code, which has gone viral, amassing more than 3M views. Ensuring that our customers and employees are continually growing and learning has helped make HubSpot a Best Place to Work in the eyes of Glassdoor, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc. The Boston Globe, and the Boston Business Journal. Founded in Cambridge, MA in 2006, HubSpot has offices in Portsmouth, NH; Dublin, Ireland; Sydney, Australia; Singapore; Tokyo, Japan; and Berlin, Germany.

We have a great benefits package including:

  • We're a public company so each employee gets stock
  • Full healthcare and dental cover
  • Pension match
  • Unlimited holidays
  • Further education scheme
  • Free breakfast, lunch, drinks (Guinness on tap!) & snacks
  • Gym at the office
  • Nap room
  • Standing desks
  • Choose your own machine

Benefits

Unlimited vacation
Competitive salary and company equity
Free fruit, yogurt, cereal, snacks, and coffee
Flexible hours and remote work environment
An engineering culture team dedicated to developer growth & happiness
Management and technology workshops
$5,000 tuition reimbursement
Healthy @ HubSpot wellness programs
Resource Groups: PeopleofColor@HubSpot, LGBTQ Alliance, Women@HubSpot
Parental Benefits, Programming, & Perks (Bring Your Kids to Work Day)

items.title: Senior Machine Learning Software Engineer at Stardog Union (Arlington, VA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Industry: Databases, Enterprise Software, Information Technology
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Stardog is the world's leading Knowledge Graph platform for the Enterprise. Turn data into knowledge faster and easier. Stardog lets you query, search, and analyze enterprise data, wherever it is, using scalable, cutting-edge Knowledge Graph technology.

We've been actively working on adding machine learning capabilities to Stardog, and are looking for someone to help us take it to the next level.


If you're interested in natural language processing, deep learning, probabilistic graphical models, and recommender systems, this might be the job you've been dreaming about!

Responsibilities

  • Research and develop algorithms to analyze large scale (un)structured data
  • Design and develop high-performance, data-driven components for our distributed database
  • Implement complex data ingestion pipelines
  • Deploy and operationalize machine learning models


Requirements:

  • 5+ years programming experience, ideally in Java
  • Strong computer science fundamentals, with advanced knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and software design
  • Experience on applying machine learning and natural language processing techniques to real world datasets
  • Interest in recent scientific developments, with an eye for practical applications
  • Knowledge of Vowpal Wabbit, Theano/Keras, GATE/UIMA, Lucene/ElasticSearch, and similar frameworks

About Stardog Union

Our culture is based on engineering excellence, mutual respect, collegiality in all things, rigor in design, research, implementation, and testing. We care deeply about work-life balance and productivity in the short and long run. In sum, if you remove the unnecessary, the distracting, and the tedious, what you're left with is a healthy 40 hour week full of wins

We are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Benefits

Health care including dental & vision, some plans fully company paid
401k
3 weeks vacation
Remote work available for qualified candidates
Top of the line hardware
Flexible work schedule
Company paid life and disability benefits
Well stocked kitchen, snacks, lunch, and most importantly, coffee

items.title: Machine Learning Engineer f/m (100% Remote) at Jaumo GmbH (Göppingen, Germany) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Industry: Dating, Messaging, Social Networking
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

We're looking for a new employee in our small five-person team and give you the opportunity to be part of a very exciting journey.

You are a Machine Learning Engineer (f/m) with strong experience, and you will be an essential part of our lean and focused company. The position is full-time. This is an excellent career opportunity to join a fast growing 100% remote company in a key position.

You will:

  • provide our fastgrowing dating app used by millions of users on a monthly basis with an intelligent and personalized experience for finding a partner
  • solve challenging problems like online dating scam/fraud/fake prevention, automated moderation, optimizing matching algorithms and our recommendation system. 
  • introduce and scale a machine learning and data processing platform
  • take ownership of your codebase
  • be accountable for all aspects of your work, from research and analysis to testing and deployment
  • work agile with a motivated and innovative small team (us, the two founders)

Skills & Requirements

An ideal candidate is autonomous, proactive, and has a professional experience with machine learning technologies. We admire engineers who take the initiative, make their own decisions and implement them precisely. 

Your qualifications:

  • at least 3 years of experience in software development, ideally in a high-performance web or mobile environment
  • solid experience in at least one of the following areas: machine learning, recommendation systems, pattern recognition, data mining or artificial intelligence
  • experience with one or more general purpose programming languages like Python, PHP, Java
  • you love getting things done you never give up, when it’s getting difficult. It’s a challenge to master every situation.
  • you speak and write business-fluent English

If this profile matches your expertise, experience, and aspirations, we’d be delighted to receive your full application, including salary requirements and possible starting date.

About Jaumo GmbH

Jaumo is one of the fastest growing dating apps worldwide with more than 30 million members in over 180 countries. The app for Android and iOS is available in 59 languages and among the Top #5 dating apps in many countries. We connect people. For fun. For love. For life.

Our company is bootstrapped and operated by just the two founders. We're not a start-up anymore, and we have proven that we built a sustainable business in a fast-growing, competitive and profitable sector.

The perks:

  • remote and flexible (work from anywhere within a timezone you choose)
  • 30 paid personal vacation days per year
  • only the best hardware and software (use what works best for you)
  • personal home office budget (2,000 € to buy what you need every 2 years)
  • make a difference (we're laser-focused and lean)

Benefits

Be our number 1 employee
Lean company - no bullshit
We work remote
Flexible schedules
Ability to work with cutting-edge technology
Competitive salary
You can make a difference
Paid time off

items.title: Principal Software Engineer - Big Data Performance at Carbon Black (Boulder, CO) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Computer Software, Cybersecurity, Information Technology
Company size: 501-1k people
Company type: Private

Job description

The Principal Software Engineer - Big Data Performance will co-lead, define and build for performance and scale the next generation of endpoint security applications. This is more than a chance to write amazing code for something at significant scale with talented peers. It is a chance to have a huge impact on how hundreds of companies and governments visualize and neutralize threats to their networks. This is where global politics meet your code and the people who it empowers. Join us to make something that matters.

What You’ll Do

  • Design and optimize the performance of a backend data processing pipeline that is resilient to failures and is highly scalable.
  • Plan, monitor and improve the performance of a distributed application to process a lot of streaming data.
  • Review and guide development of Restful APIs to query terabytes of data.
  • Participate in all phases of the software development cycle as part of a Scrum team.
  • Proactively move the technology base to use latest tools and frameworks for best performance; considering costs and scale.
  • Collaborate with product management, DevOps, backend, and front-end engineers to deliver the right solution.
  • Support existing production code and improve performance enhancements and products.

What You’ll Bring

Principal Software Engineer - Big Data Performance, you’ll plan for high-performance computing, build and improve a highly scalable and reliable system to process and store terabytes of data.

  • 7-10 years of experience developing server side applications.
  • 2-4 years building high performing/data intensive applications running in the cloud.
  • Implement changes for performance, scalability and reliability
  • Experience with:
    • Java
    • Restful APIs
    • JMS, AMQP, SQS
    • Git
    • Scaling enterprise applications in the cloud
    • Reducing costs in production
    • Agile Software Development

Bonus Points:

  • B.S./M.S. in Computer Science or related degree
  • NoSQL technologies
  • AWS & Elastic Search
  • CI/CD pipeline

Why Carbon Black?

At Carbon Black, you’ll have the chance to make an impact in the ever-evolving cybersecurity space. Our advanced technology tackles even the toughest challenges and stays ahead of the latest threats.

If you want to join an agile company that’s building bleeding edge technology in the cloud, Carbon Black is the place for you. Driven by passionate people who are dedicated to making the world safer, it’s no wonder we’ve been named a “Top Place to Work” by the Boston Globe for three consecutive years. Join us!

About Carbon Black

Who We Are

Carbon Black is the leading provider of next-generation endpoint security. Carbon Black’s Next-Generation Antivirus (NGAV) solution, Cb Defense, leverages breakthrough prevention technology, “Streaming Prevention,” to instantly see and stop cyberattacks before they execute. Cb Defense uniquely combines breakthrough prevention with market-leading detection and response into a single, lightweight agent delivered through the cloud. With more than 7 million endpoints under management, Carbon Black has more than 2,500 customers, including 30 of the Fortune 100. These customers use Carbon Black to replace legacy antivirus, lock down critical systems, hunt threats, and protect their endpoints from the most advanced cyberattacks, including non-malware attacks.

Carbon Black, Inc. is an EEO/AA employer. Carbon Black is an inclusive employer that believes in workplace equality, supports diversity, creates a welcoming environment, and respects the unique qualities each individual brings to the company. 

Benefits

Flexible vacation
Remote/Work-from-home options
Medical/Dental/Vision
Stand-up desks and unique workspaces
Free snacks/drinks, Happy Hours, and regular catering
Care.com access and pet insurance
On-site gym
Career development programs
Lounge/game room
Competitive salaries, 401k, and stock options

items.title: Senior Data Scientist at REAN Cloud (Boulder, CO) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Data Scientist
Industry: Cloud Computing, Digital Health, Education Technology
Company size: 201-500 people
Company type: Private

Job description

REAN Cloud is a Premier Amazon Web Services Provider and has grown over 500% in the past year and a half. That growth would not be possible without identifying top talent within one of the fastest growing verticals in technology. 

You would be collaborating with a talented, senior team providing best-in-class solutions for extremely complex problems and have the ability to work on the most cutting edge technology platforms and tools available. 

If you have experience automating large scale deployments with modern configuration and deployment management systems this could be the ideal role for you. REAN Cloud works with enterprise level organizations on some of the world’s largest automation and cloud deployment projects, and get to work with the coolest technologies throughout the process!

Data Scientist

Skills

  • Extensive background leading analysis and modeling to provide business insights
  • Excellent problem solving skills with the ability to design algorithms including data profiling, clustering, anomaly detection, and predictive modeling
  • Hands-on experience developing advanced descriptive, real-time and predictive analytics in SQL, R, Python, Hadoop, Spark, SparkML, Hive, Presto, MXNet, TensorFlow
  • Experience developing machine learning solutions
  • Proficient with SQL databases and knowledge of standard methodologies
  • Expertise in creation of insights with reports and dashboards using industry standard business intelligence tools like Tableau, Looker and Jupyter Notebooks
  • Experience with AWS data services like Kinesis, EMR, Redshift, Data Pipeline
  • Ability to work with development teams to deliver high-quality
  • Agile / Scrum development methodology

Key Focus Areas

  • Advanced statistical techniques to create high performing predictive models and creative analyses to address business challenges
  • Business intelligence visualization of insights for customers
  • Consultative customer interactions and deliverables
  • Large-scale data management & workflow
  • Analytic development and automation

If this sounds like something you’d be interested in pursuing, please don’t hesitate to apply today! We are growing at an unprecedented rate and this is a great time to get in on the ground floor of something extremely exciting.

About REAN Cloud

REAN Cloud, a Premier AWS Partner is growing substantially and looking for a highly driven individual with excellent leadership qualities to support our talented sales team. REAN Cloud works with startups to enterprise level organizations providing best in class solutions for some of the world’s largest cloud integration projects. Companies near and far are looking to the cloud for simplicity in business, instantaneous data retrieval and constant collaboration beyond boundaries.  REAN Cloud is on the forefront of this market and our services are in demand.  The REAN Cloud Sales team is responsible for identifying, qualifying and capturing the business of companies taking their infrastructure to the cloud.

For any further information, please visit our website at or contact us at info@reancloud.com or +1 (844) 377-7326.

items.title: Online Video Instructor for Java Frameworks Training at LinkedIn Learning at Lynda Teach (Carpinteria, CA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer, Backend Developer
Industry: Online Education
Company size: 10k+ people
Company type: Public

Job description

Transform people's lives. Teach skills to create opportunity.  Apply to be a LinkedIn Learning/Lynda author today!

Please note that this is a contract-based course instructor role, not an in-house developer position.

At Lynda, we believe in connecting people to opportunity by sharing knowledge. With millions of members, your voice and expertise can make a difference.

Are you an experienced technology professional with a passion to teach and share your expertise? Do you thrive on taking the complex and making it simple? 'Is the "why" just as important as the "how" to you? If you have knowledge to share, let’s connect! We’re seeking backend developers to create video training courses for our rapidly-growing audience.

If you have a passion for and experience working with these Java Frameworks, let’s talk!

  • Java EE
  • JavaServer Faces (JSF) & PrimeFaces
  • Spring & Spring Boot
  • Play!
  • DropWizard
  • Netty

As a Linkedin Learning/Lynda instructor, you get more than a platform - you get a partner. We pride ourselves on producing the highest quality educational courses available. You’ll partner with content area experts to scope and refine your ideas, then work with a professional production team of instructional designers, producers, graphic designers, editors, and QA specialists to assemble your world-class technology training course. Our well-established production process allows you to spend more time creating course content, while we take the lead on designing, producing, and editing the course. Ready to get started?

Join our passionate and experienced team of educators and technologists!

Note: we are always looking for new authors across the technology spectrum; even if you do not see your technical expertise listed, please inquire and clearly list your topics of expertise/interest. 

Skills & Requirements

  • Deep knowledge of, and professional experience with, the technologies you wish to teach
  • Prior teaching experience preferred, but not required
  • Involvement with the Java developer ecosystem and community preferred
  • Interest in e-learning as a medium, either as a trainer or student
  • Ability to respond to and incorporate feedback productively
  • Ability to commit approximately 30 hours to developing a course (over several months) and 1-week to record in one of our studios (travel expenses paid). Remote recording options available.

Steps to Becoming a Lynda Author

  1. Speak to one of our Content Managers about your background, our process and course ideas.
  2. Work with your Content Manager to put together a short (3-5 minute), un-edited sample movie.  
  3. Work on a Table of Contents and Course Description with your Content Manager.
  4. Set schedule & work with a Producer to build out course materials--scripts, slides and technical demos, as appropriate.
  5. Fly out to one of our studios to record your course, with guidance from your Producer in the recording booth.
  6. Help resolve any bugs found in editing, post-production and quality assurance stages (usually <1 hour of work on author’s part).

About Lynda Teach

LinkedIn Learning/Lynda is the leading online learning platform that helps anyone learn software, technology, business, and creative skills to achieve personal and professional goals. Through individual, corporate, academic and government subscriptions, members have access to the video library of engaging, top-quality courses taught by recognized industry experts.

For 20 years, we've helped students, leaders, IT and design pros, project managers—anyone in any role—build software, creative, and business skills. Now part of Linkedin Learning, Lynda serves more than 10,000 organizations. With tutorials in five languages, Lynda is a global platform for success.

Benefits

Earn advances and royalties
Work remotely
Work part time
Join a supportive and cohesive team
Work freelance
Give back to your community
Get full editing and graphics support

items.title: Data Analyst (m/f) at komoot (Berlin, Germany) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Data Scientist
Industry: Cycling, Information Technology, Mobile Application
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Millions of people experience real-life adventures with our apps. We help users all over the world discover the best hiking and biking routes, and we empower everybody to explore more of the great outdoors. To help us be even better at what we do, we’re looking for a data analyst to help us to drive product decisions and strategy. We believe that data-driven decision making is key to our success and your skills and curiosity will play a crucial role in building the future of outdoor experiences.

Your key responsibilities

  • Turn events and data into actionable insights
  • Develop analysis to drive product and business decisions and strategy
  • Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and continuous reports
  • Communicate and present findings to different audiences
  • Working closely with teams throughout the company, solving very diverse data challenges
  • Be an evangelist of data-driven decision-making

Why you will love it

  • You’ll be a key player in making product development, marketing and business decisions
  • You’ll work with a modern and powerful analytics platform based on AWS Kinesis and Redshift
  • You’ll work in a fast-paced startup with strongly motivated and talented co-workers
  • You’ll enjoy the freedom to organize yourself the way you want and work with whichever tools you love
  • We let you work from wherever you want, be it a beach, the mountains, our headquarters in Potsdam or anywhere else that lies in any time zone between UTC-1 and UTC+3
  • Every day, your work will inspire people to discover more of the great outdoors
  • You’ll join us for team gatherings in locations like Mallorca or the Bavarian Alps several times a year

You will be successful in this position if you

  • Have a burning desire to transform data into actionable insights
  • Have 3+ years of relevant experience interpreting data
  • Have proven skills in programming (e.g. in python), SQL and Pandas/R
  • Have strong communication skills
  • Have fundamental statistical skills
  • Are keen to keep in touch with the latest advances in your area
  • Have a hands-on attitude and are highly self-driven

Sounds like you?

Then send us the following:

  • Your CV
  • A write-up explaining who you are and why you are interested in working at komoot
  • Examples of your work (e.g. GitHub, PDFs, Slideshare, etc.)
  • Feel free to send us something that shows us a little more about what you’re interested in, be it your Twitter/Instagram account, or your OpenStreetMap profile if you have one
  • You’ll get bonus points for: Doing something creative with komoot (we love it when people go the extra mile)

About komoot

We Love What We Do

Komoot is the world’s leading outdoor app. We offer modern explorers best-in-class tech so that hikers and bikers have topographic maps, turn-by-turn navigation, recommendations on cool places and more at their fingertips.

The Freedom To Rock Your Craft

The world’s leading outdoor app, komoot hires the best folks to do what they love. Have a passion for the great outdoors and an ability to get things done? You might be the superstar we’re searching for.

Benefits

Work wherever you thrive
28 paid vacation days
Health insurance
Latest computers and devices

items.title: Back End Data Engineer at Clevertech () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Back End Data Engineer to join our global team. We are looking for team members to help us develop world class software products for the most exclusive organizations in the world. We have been at this for sixteen years, and continue to grow off our best asset, our people.

This role has database design and implementation responsibilities including alternative data structures such as nosql, redis, elastic search and more. 

---

REQUIREMENTS:

Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code. You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like minded individuals.

Technically, you have 3 years experience in with complex data structures.

Well qualified applicants will have deep experience in the latest libraries and programming techniques. You will have accomplishments that showcase your capabilities by their success and technical depth.

About Clevertech

BENEFITS

OWN YOUR TIME

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

FOCUSED WORK

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

LEARN AT YOUR EDGES

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

RECHARGE TIME

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out why.clevertech.biz.

Benefits

Full-Time Telecommuting
Flexible Schedules

items.title: Front End Developer at High Growth Social Media Company (AI/machine learning) EU at BrandBastion () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Social Media
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

DESCRIPTION

Full-time remote position available only for candidates in the GMT to GMT+3 time zones.

BrandBastion is a rapidly growing company focused on disrupting the brand reputation and ad performance services on social media with the use of AI and machine learning. We work with Fortune 500 companies, governments, start-ups and non-profits in North America, South America, Europe, Asia and Australia. We are backed by great investors such as Mårten Mickos (HackerOne) and Risto Siilasmaa (founder of F-Secure).

We are scouting for a front end multi-talent to join our A-team full time:

You are passionate about designing, developing and implementing web interfaces and apps for next-gen services using frameworks such as React. You want to lead and drive change in your own area. You function best in a fast-paced environment with focus on execution. You are self-organized, self-motivated, a good communicator and you inspire others through your work.

You will:

  • Lead the front end side of our software projects
  • Be actively involved in architecting new services and products together with our core team
  • Will work on building single-page real time web applications with focus on performance, usability and user experience
  • Be proactive and up-to-date with the latest changes in the industry
  • Share our values: focus on execution, adaptability and agility, knowledge above hierarchy, self-drive and constant improvement.

Skills & Requirements

  • Experience with any of the following would be an asset: SaaS, CRM, real-time web applications, interactive dashboards
  • Extensive JavaScript knowledge (+3 years)
  • Working experience with React (+Redux), Angular (optional)
  • You like fast responsive interfaces and know how to optimize them
  • ES6, Node.js, NPM, CSS (SASS), D3.js
  • Data APIs, Websocket
  • Extensive testing and CI knowledge
  • UI/UX prototyping, usability, responsive design would be an asset
  • Good team communicator and collaborator with excellent English skills
  • Innovative and entrepreneurial mindset

About BrandBastion

BrandBastion is a growth company specialized in real time protection of brand reputation and ad performance on social media. We fight trolls and pirates on a daily basis and remove harmful user-generated content from our clients' social media properties within 8 minutes 24/7.

We work with governments and Fortune 500 companies in for example gaming, entertainment, e-commerce and technology.

We've developed a large scale web platform that handles large amounts of real time social media data (Facebook, Instagram and YouTube, etc.) incorporated with innovative technologies such as machine learning and AI to bring a new standard to online brand protection.

Benefits

Flexible working hours
5 star investors and advisors such as Marten Mickos and Risto Siilasma
Competitive compensation + possibility to acquire equity
Opportunities to travel
Awesome customers and great coworkers
5 weeks paid vacation

items.title: Data Engineer at Formstack (Indianapolis, IN) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Information Technology, SaaS, Web Technology
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Formstack, the most flexible and powerful form building application, is looking for a Data Engineer to add to its already awesome Dev team.

Formstack is an 11 year old company with its roots in Indianapolis. Our customers span 110 different countries, and our employees live and work across the U.S. and the globe. We provide a remote work environment that is flexible and provides great freedom for those who can perform.

What You Will Do:

This position will focus on creating, maintaining and optimizing the way we store data. You will work with and create APIs to digest data and store within a data warehouse. You will understand how multiple data points work together and how they should be stored. You will evaluate and create services to make reporting of data easy for your co-workers. We are a data driven company and you will own all the data points the company uses to make decisions. Needless to say, you like a challenge, complex problems and responsibility.

Who You Are:

You are a problem solver and are motivated to learn. You are a great communicator, collaborative, detail oriented and can see a project through from start to finish. You are able to make decisions on your own but know when to ask for help. You understand it takes a team to build something powerful and don't mind constructive feedback. You are familiar with big data storage and understand there are more ways to store things than just MySQL. You have experience in large scale data store projects and architecture and can bring some wisdom from previous projects.

Requirements

  • PHP with Unit Testing (PHPUnit)
  • Deep knowledge of SQL (MySQL and noSQL)
  • Git
  • Solid experience in at least one of the following
    • building micro services
    • high-use APIs
  • Ability to use command line tools
  • Ability to work remote and with remote team members
  • Excellent written and oral English communication skills
  • The ability to work independently but also work well within a team environment.
  • The ability to travel (<10%) for team meetups, conferences, etc.

Extra Credit Qualifications

  • Experience with AWS or comparable cloud-computing platform
  • Experience building large-scale high-performance systems
  • RJ Metrics or a similar service
  • Salesforce
  • Jupyter Notebooks experience
  • Data warehouse implementation experience

What Formstack Offers:

  • Remote environment
  • 100% Covered Medical, Dental, Vision as well as company-paid Disability and Life Insurance Benefits for full-time employees
  • 401k with matching company contribution for full-time employees
  • The most up-to-date technology, including company-issued Macs, the latest software and other tools needed to excel at your job
  • Company-paid conferences and extended learning
  • Yearly company gatherings
  • Unlimited PTO for all employees

Want to learn more about who we are and what we value? Check out this Video and apply if you want to jump into the next great chapter of your life.

About Formstack

Formstack is an 11 year old company with its roots in Indianapolis. Our customers span 110 different countries, and our employees live and work across the U.S. and the globe. We provide a remote work environment that is flexible and provides great freedom

Benefits

The most up-to-date software
401k Safe Harbor Match
Lunch everyday paid for by Formstack (for employees in Indianapolis)
Generous PTO policy
Remote working office
All the snacks you can handle
Company-contributions to HSA
Monthly company "fun"
Yearly team-building event for the whole company
All the pings and pongs you can handle!

items.title: Machine Learning Software Engineer @ Stardog
items.content:
Machine Learning Software Engineer @ Stardog

2017-11-03 02:13

Description

Stardog is the world's leading Knowledge Graph platform for the Enterprise. Turn data into knowledge faster and easier. Stardog lets you query, search, and analyze enterprise data, wherever it is, using scalable, cutting-edge Knowledge Graph technology.

We've been actively working on adding machine learning capabilities to Stardog, and are looking for someone to help us take it to the next level.If you're interested in natural language processing, deep learning, probabilistic graphical models, and recommender systems, this might be the job you've been dreaming about!

Responsibilities

  • Research and develop algorithms to analyze large scale (un)structured data
  • Design and develop high-performance, data-driven components for our distributed database
  • Implement complex data ingestion pipelines
  • Deploy and operationalize machine learning models

Requirements:

  • 5+ years programming experience, ideally in Java
  • Strong computer science fundamentals, with advanced knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and software design
  • Experience on applying machine learning and natural language processing techniques to real world datasets
  • Interest in recent scientific developments, with an eye for practical applications
  • Knowledge of Vowpal Wabbit, Theano/Keras, GATE/UIMA, Lucene/ElasticSearch, and similar frameworks
  • Ability to work in a distributed team mainly communicating over email, chat, and phone
  • Experience with graph technologies or databases is a plus

We have offices in Arlington, VA and Boston, MA. Remote working is also possible for qualified candidates.

Our culture is based on engineering excellence, mutual respect, collegiality in all things, rigor in design, research, implementation, and testing. We care deeply about work-life balance and productivity in the short and long run. In sum, if you remove the unnecessary, the distracting, and the tedious, what you're left with is a healthy 40 hour week full of wins.

We are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Country

Anywhere

2017-11-03 02:11

items.title: Data Scientist/ Machine Learning Architect
items.content:
About you

If you care about software quality but find testing and QA boring, as someone with machine learning expertise, you may have always thought "there must be a better way"!
Do you love building new stuff, learning and working with emerging technologies, alongside a team of skilled engineers with the same passion as yours? Driven to build a unique and groundbreaking product? Want to work on something that has not been done before?
If so, we would like to hear from you.


About us

We are SpotQA's Product Team, building the next generation of testing automation software.
We are building the self-driving car technology for the testing world.
Our objective? To develop new technology using machine-learning and domain expertise with the aim of performing testing fully autonomously
To help with our mission, we are looking for a Senior Data Scientist with machine learning expertise to join our team


REQUIREMENTS

Since we're building emerging technology, we're looking for solid engineering skills and experience, with solid knowledge of the theoretical fundamentals. Most importantly, we are looking for can-do attitudes, a passion to learn/grow independently and willingness to delve into problems.

We have our eyes on a few skills, namely:

Strong practical experience and theoretical background in machine learning.
Strong programming skills in at least one major programming language (e.g., Java, C++, Python)
A postgraduate degree (preferably PhD) in a relevant machine learning topic is desirable.
Ability to apply cross-domain knowledge to solve new machine-learning problems, and able to create/apply a multitude of ML solutions to solve a problem from different angles.
Can demonstrate expertise in neural networks/deep-learning techniques, RNNs, CNNs, LSTMs.
Polyglot: can program effectively in a wide range of programming languages and frameworks.


BENEFITS

Competitive Salary.
Possibility of working remotely is available.
Personal development by working with a fast growing multinational startup aiming to shape the future of Digital QA.

items.title: Full Time: Data Engineer at Doximity in San Francisco or Remote
items.content:
Doximity is rewiring healthcare and is the 6th fastest-growing technology company in North America ( http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/doximity-is-fastest-growing-company-in-bay-area-per-deloittes-2016-technology-fast-500-300367390.html ). Here's how clinicians use our products. ( https://res.cloudinary.com/dhttas9u5/image/upload/WhyDocsUseDox-Infographic_20160930_adpvj6.pdf ) For us, transparency is key. Ensuring your goals and values align with ours is also an important step. Take a look at how we Work at Doximity. ( https://workat.doximity.com/ )

You will join a small team of data infrastructure engineers (4) to build and maintain all aspects of our data pipelines, ETL processes, data warehousing, ingestion and overall data infrastructure. We have one of the richest healthcare datasets in the world, and we're not afraid to invest in all things data to enhance our ability to extract insight.

What You'll Work On

  • Help establish robust solutions for consolidating data from a variety of data sources.
  • Collaborate with product managers and data scientists to architect pipelines to support delivery of recommendations and insights from machine learning models.
  • Build and maintain efficient data integration, matching, and ingestion pipelines.
  • Establish data architecture processes and practices that can be scheduled, automated, replicated and serve as standards for other teams to leverage.
  • Build instrumentation, alerting and error-recovery system for the entire data infrastructure.
  • Spearhead, plan and carry out the implementation of solutions while self-managing.
  • We expect you to be very comfortable around Unix, Git, and AWS.

Must Have Skills & Requirements

  • At least three years of professional experience developing data infrastructure solutions.
  • Fluency in Python and SQL.
  • Experience building data pipelines with Spark and Kafka.
  • Passion for clean code and testing with Pytest, FactoryBoy, or equivalent.
  • Comprehensive experience with Unix, Git, and AWS tooling.
  • Astute ability to self-manage, prioritize, and deliver functional solutions.

Nice to Have Skills & Requirements

  • Experience with MySQL replication, binary logs, and log shipping.
  • Experience with additional technologies such as Hive, EMR, Presto or similar technologies.
  • Experience with MPP databases such as Redshift and working with both normalized and denormalized data models.
  • Knowledge of data design principles and experience using ETL frameworks such as Sqoop or equivalent.
  • Experience designing, implementing and scheduling data pipelines on workflow tools like Airflow, or equivalent.
  • Experience working with Docker, PyCharm, Neo4j, Elasticsearch, or equivalent.

Our Data Stack

  • Python, Kafka, Spark, MySQL, Redshift, Presto, Airflow, Neo4j, Elasticsearch

Fun Facts About the Team

  • We have access to one of the richest healthcare datasets in the world, with deep information on hundreds of thousands of healthcare professionals and their connections.
  • Business decisions at Doximity are driven by our data, analyses, and insights.
  • Hundreds of thousands of healthcare professionals will utilize the products you build.
  • Our R&D team makes up about half the company, and the product is led by the R&D team.
  • Our Data Science team is comprised of about 20 people.

Benefits & Perks

  • Comprehensive benefits including medical, vision, dental, Life/ADD, 401k, flex spending accounts, and commuter benefits
  • Stock, pre-IPO stock incentives
  • Work from home Wednesdays (for HQ employees)
  • 3+ weeks of PTO
  • 12 company holidays, including company shut-down in December
  • Fully ergonomic setup in HQ
  • Free lunch, snacks, and beverages in HQ
  • Rooftop game room and deck with a beautiful view of SF skyline in HQ
  • Team trips to fun places like Lake Tahoe, Sonoma, Seattle and Park City
  • 5th-year sabbatical

About Doximity

Doximity is the leading social network for healthcare professionals with over 75% of U.S. doctors as members. We have strong revenues, profits, real market traction, and were putting a dent in the inefficiencies of our $2.5 trillion U.S. healthcare system. After the iPhone, Doximity is the fastest adopted product by doctors of all time. Our founder, Jeff Tangney, is the founder & former President and COO of Epocrates (IPO in 2010), and Nate Gross is the founder of digital health accelerator RockHealth. Our investors include top venture capital firms who've invested in Box, Salesforce, Skype, SpaceX, Tesla Motors, Twitter, Tumblr, Mulesoft, and Yammer. Our beautiful offices are located in SoMa San Francisco.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate by race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

items.title: Scientific Consultant / Field Application Scientist - Genedata - United Kingdom
items.content:
Scientific Consultant / Field Application Scientist
Genedata -United Kingdom
We are looking for a Scientific Consultant / Field Application Scientist for a full-time permanent position as a Scientific Account Manager (SAM). This position is within our Genedata Screener business unit, and requires about 30% travel within Europe, and occasional travel to North America. We are also able to offer remote working to the right candidate.

The Scientific Account Manager is a scientific and technical consultant for our customers. A SAM has a very dynamic job – you will wear many different hats, interact with many different people, and use your scientific and technical knowledge to solve real-world scientific screening problems. This position is especially well suited for you if you have a scientific/technical background, enjoy variety in your daily work, and want to expand your skill set (scientific, technical, and soft skills).

This full-time position is based in the UK. The onboarding process will include up to six months of part-time training at our Basel headquarters, with regular visits (at least once per month) thereafter.

Key responsibilitiesFirst and foremost, you will become an expert in scientific and informatics matters related to biological (small and large molecule) screening data analysis in general and the use of our Genedata Screener software in particular. You will combine this expertise with excellent communication skills and project management know-how to (a) support our customers in getting the most out of Genedata Screener, (b) aid our sales team, and (c) propose, plan, execute and manage service projects.

(a) You will establish a relationship based on trust with our customers by being their first point of contact and sparring partner on scientific and technical matters. We want our customers to have excellent screening processes, and it will be your job to get them there. You will also provide user training, and product support.

(b) You will work in tandem with our Business Account Managers in establishing and communicating the value of Genedata Screener to prospects and customers. Tasks include qualifying customer needs, giving pre-sales presentations and demos, and managing software evaluation projects.

(c) In addition, you will act as project manager for projects of different types: scientific consulting, software implementation, systems integration, and data analysis projects. You will ensure their delivery at the level of excellence that our customers know us for. This involves proper project set up and planning to achieve the customer’s goals; specifying and coordinating the implementation work of our developers; guaranteeing adherence to scope, budget and time lines; managing change in the project; controlling the quality of all deliverables; providing customer feedback to product management; and supporting the Screener team to keep improving our processes.

In addition to the core responsibilities listed above, we want you to help all of us in the Screener team to improve, and we count on your knowledge, creativity, and technical skills to further advance our science, marketing, development, and product management.

Your profileEssential Skills and Experience
  • You will be exposed to a range of different people, so you should feel comfortable interacting with customers at all levels (managers, scientists, and IT experts) and be prepared to constantly communicate internally.
  • We are particularly looking for candidates with a degree (preferably post-graduate) within quantitative biology, bioinformatics, applied physics, applied mathematics, or a related field.
  • In addition, 2+ years of industry experience would be a definitive advantage, especially in a pharmaceutical or biotechnology company, a contract research organization, a consulting company, a provider of scientific software, or the software department of a provider of screening instrumentation. If you do not have experience in any of these companies, we look forward to receiving your application if you possess the skills listed below, are a fast learner and wish to quickly delve into the scientific and technical challenges of cutting-edge screening technologies in the context of Pharmaceutical R&D.
Additional Preferred Skills and Experience

Technical skills:
  • The role involves scripting and working with UNIX systems, which means that experience with at least one scripting language (preferably Python) as well as basic familiarity with the UNIX shell environment will get you up to speed faster.
  • Familiarity with Java, networks, databases, data mining, image analysis, distributed systems, and/or web technologies is an advantage, but not strictly required for the job.
  • Experience in managing IT projects involving multiple stakeholders is a clear plus.
Industry knowledge:
  • You will work with a range of screening technologies and application areas (please see our website for currently supported technologies), so deeper knowledge within a few or broader knowledge across several of them would be desirable
  • Our customers are mainly pharmaceutical research organizations, thus your experience with pharmaceutical research and the drug discovery process would be valuable to us.

The companyGenedata is an exceptional company. With nearly two decades of success in research informatics using closely-knit teams of scientists, developers, and business experts, Genedata has achieved steady and continuous growth since inception. As a private and majority employee-owned organization, we empower each employee to be a contributing voice in the company operations and evolution. Our collective expertise in research informatics, combined with our open and scalable computational solutions, makes us the leading software provider in discovery informatics for biotech, pharmaceuticals, and related life sciences. We are headquartered in Basel, Switzerland and have subsidiaries in Germany, USA, UK and Japan.

About Genedata Screener® Business UnitGenedata Screener® analyzes, visualizes, and manages screening data from in-vitro screening assay technologies across the enterprise, including very complex as well as ultra-high throughput experiments. Its screening-oriented business logic enables rapid processing and comprehensive analysis of complete campaigns.

Are you interested?If you are interested in this position, please email your CV and your motivation letter to recruitment@genedata.com along with the reference number UK-SCR-SAM .

Genedata is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Genedata only accepts CVs and resumes directly from candidates. Personnel recruitment agencies need not respond.

Its screening-oriented business logic enables rapid processing and comprehensive analysis of complete campaigns.

Are you interested?If you are interested in this position, please email your CV and your motivation letter to recruitment@genedata.com along with the reference number UK-SCR-SAM .

Genedata is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

items.title: Scientific Consultant / Field Application Scientist - Genedata - United Kingdom
items.content:
Scientific Consultant / Field Application Scientist
Genedata -United Kingdom
We are looking for a Scientific Consultant / Field Application Scientist for a full-time permanent position as a Scientific Account Manager (SAM). This position is within our Genedata Screener business unit, and requires about 30% travel within Europe, and occasional travel to North America. We are also able to offer remote working to the right candidate.

The Scientific Account Manager is a scientific and technical consultant for our customers. A SAM has a very dynamic job – you will wear many different hats, interact with many different people, and use your scientific and technical knowledge to solve real-world scientific screening problems. This position is especially well suited for you if you have a scientific/technical background, enjoy variety in your daily work, and want to expand your skill set (scientific, technical, and soft skills).

This full-time position is based in the UK. The onboarding process will include up to six months of part-time training at our Basel headquarters, with regular visits (at least once per month) thereafter.

Key responsibilitiesFirst and foremost, you will become an expert in scientific and informatics matters related to biological (small and large molecule) screening data analysis in general and the use of our Genedata Screener software in particular. You will combine this expertise with excellent communication skills and project management know-how to (a) support our customers in getting the most out of Genedata Screener, (b) aid our sales team, and (c) propose, plan, execute and manage service projects.

(a) You will establish a relationship based on trust with our customers by being their first point of contact and sparring partner on scientific and technical matters. We want our customers to have excellent screening processes, and it will be your job to get them there. You will also provide user training, and product support.

(b) You will work in tandem with our Business Account Managers in establishing and communicating the value of Genedata Screener to prospects and customers. Tasks include qualifying customer needs, giving pre-sales presentations and demos, and managing software evaluation projects.

(c) In addition, you will act as project manager for projects of different types: scientific consulting, software implementation, systems integration, and data analysis projects. You will ensure their delivery at the level of excellence that our customers know us for. This involves proper project set up and planning to achieve the customer’s goals; specifying and coordinating the implementation work of our developers; guaranteeing adherence to scope, budget and time lines; managing change in the project; controlling the quality of all deliverables; providing customer feedback to product management; and supporting the Screener team to keep improving our processes.

In addition to the core responsibilities listed above, we want you to help all of us in the Screener team to improve, and we count on your knowledge, creativity, and technical skills to further advance our science, marketing, development, and product management.

Your profileEssential Skills and Experience
  • You will be exposed to a range of different people, so you should feel comfortable interacting with customers at all levels (managers, scientists, and IT experts) and be prepared to constantly communicate internally.
  • We are particularly looking for candidates with a degree (preferably post-graduate) within quantitative biology, bioinformatics, applied physics, applied mathematics, or a related field.
  • In addition, 2+ years of industry experience would be a definitive advantage, especially in a pharmaceutical or biotechnology company, a contract research organization, a consulting company, a provider of scientific software, or the software department of a provider of screening instrumentation. If you do not have experience in any of these companies, we look forward to receiving your application if you possess the skills listed below, are a fast learner and wish to quickly delve into the scientific and technical challenges of cutting-edge screening technologies in the context of Pharmaceutical R&D.
Additional Preferred Skills and Experience

Technical skills:
  • The role involves scripting and working with UNIX systems, which means that experience with at least one scripting language (preferably Python) as well as basic familiarity with the UNIX shell environment will get you up to speed faster.
  • Familiarity with Java, networks, databases, data mining, image analysis, distributed systems, and/or web technologies is an advantage, but not strictly required for the job.
  • Experience in managing IT projects involving multiple stakeholders is a clear plus.
Industry knowledge:
  • You will work with a range of screening technologies and application areas (please see our website for currently supported technologies), so deeper knowledge within a few or broader knowledge across several of them would be desirable
  • Our customers are mainly pharmaceutical research organizations, thus your experience with pharmaceutical research and the drug discovery process would be valuable to us.

The companyGenedata is an exceptional company. With nearly two decades of success in research informatics using closely-knit teams of scientists, developers, and business experts, Genedata has achieved steady and continuous growth since inception. As a private and majority employee-owned organization, we empower each employee to be a contributing voice in the company operations and evolution. Our collective expertise in research informatics, combined with our open and scalable computational solutions, makes us the leading software provider in discovery informatics for biotech, pharmaceuticals, and related life sciences. We are headquartered in Basel, Switzerland and have subsidiaries in Germany, USA, UK and Japan.

About Genedata Screener® Business UnitGenedata Screener® analyzes, visualizes, and manages screening data from in-vitro screening assay technologies across the enterprise, including very complex as well as ultra-high throughput experiments. Its screening-oriented business logic enables rapid processing and comprehensive analysis of complete campaigns.

Are you interested?If you are interested in this position, please email your CV and your motivation letter to recruitment@genedata.com along with the reference number UK-SCR-SAM .

Genedata is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Genedata only accepts CVs and resumes directly from candidates. Personnel recruitment agencies need not respond.

items.title: Applications Systems Analyst/Programmer (HPC) - Medical Science & Computing, Inc. - Work at Home
items.content:
Applications Systems Analyst/Programmer (HPC)
Medical Science & Computing, Inc. -Work at Home
Full-time, Other
Medical Science & Computing (MSC) is an exciting growth oriented company, dedicated to providing mission critical scientific and technical services to the Federal Government. We have a distinguished history of supporting the National Institutes of Health (NIH) and other government agencies. MSC offers a dynamic and upbeat work environment, excellent benefits and career growth opportunities.

We attract the best people in the business with our competitive benefits package that includes medical, dental and vision coverage, 401k plan with employer contribution, paid holidays, vacation, Medical and Flexible Spending Accounts, Pre-Tax Transit Assistance and tuition reimbursement. If you enjoy being a part of a high performing, professional service and technology focused organization, please apply today!

MSC is currently searching for a High Performance Computing (HPC) Applications Systems Analyst / Programmer to support the Department of Commerce. This opportunity is slated to be full-time, virtual (telecommute), supporting multiple project sites across the US.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Under general direction, formulates and defines system scope and objectives.

Devises or modifies procedures to solve complex problems considering computer equipment capacity and limitations, operating time, and form of desired results.

Prepares detailed specifications from which programs will be written.

Designs, codes, tests, debugs, and documents those programs.

Competent to work at the highest technical level of all phases of applications systems analysis and programming activities.

May be responsible for completion of a phase of a project.

Regularly provides guidance and training to less-experienced analyst/programmers.

Assists in the design, development, testing, implementation, and documentation of new software and enhancements of existing applications.

Works with project managers, developers, and end users to ensure application designs meet business requirements.

Formulates/defines specifications for complex operating software programming applications or modifies/maintains complex existing applications using engineering releases and utilities from the manufacturer.

Provides overall operating system support, such as sophisticated file maintenance routines, large telecommunications networks, computer accounting, and advanced mathematical/scientific software packages.

Assists all phases of software systems programming applications.

Evaluates new and existing software products.

Experience:
Experience working in a High Performance Computing (HPC) / Supercomputing / Cluster Environment

Preferred Bachelor's degree from an accredited university in computer science, software engineering, information systems, a physical science, engineering or a mathematics-intensive discipline with 3-5 years of relevant experience.

Demonstrated experience with similar programs that include development/sustainment, or agile development methodology (Scrum).

Desired S/W Language Experience – Java, Oracle, Linux (RHEL and/or CentOS); Apache Camel, JBoss, Tomcat, Spring, Puppet, Git, JMS, SOAP, REST

Medical Science & Computing, LLC is an Equal Opportunity /Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

items.title: Junior Data Analyst - London, New York, Amsterdam or Berlin
items.content:
At Snowplow we are on a mission to empower people to use data to differentiate: by providing technology that gives them control of their data, and services that enable them to do amazing things with that control. As part of that effort, we're changing the way that people do digital analytics: moving companies away from having one-size-fits-all vendors like Google Analytics and Adobe dictate what should be done with their data, and enabling them to collect and own their data themselves, so they can decide:

*What data they want to collect.
*What questions they want to ask of that data.
*How they want to answer those question. (What analyses techniques to employ, what tools to use to execute those analyses.)
*How they want to action the insight developed.

We're looking for curiously brilliant individuals to join our Services team.

*What the role entails:*

The Services team at Snowplow helps companies take control of their data, enabling them to solve problems that previously were intractable and identify opportunities that previously were not visible.

As a member of the Services team, you will:

*help our clients understand what data needs to be captured, advise them on how to best structure it, and help them implement the tracking;
*work with our clients to take their Snowplow data and use it to build insights and design and build data-driven products;
*train our clients in our methodology and approach, including how to best use the different tools in the Snowplow arsenal;
*write blog posts and guides to help the broader Snowplow and Digital Analytics communities;

You'll learn how to:

*set up and run event data pipelines;
*best structure data so it can easily be used for analysis and real-time decisioning;
*architect data models (both relational and non-relational) and implement them in SQL and Spark;
*access the data in databases (Redshift, Snowflake, BigQuery, neo4J, ...) and real-time (Elasticsearch, Kinesis, Lambda, ...);
*use modern data analysis tools (Python, Spark, )
*set up and use BI tools (Redash, Metabase, Superset, Looker, Tableau, ...);
*use data to solve actual business problems;
*and much more...

You'll get an on-the-job training in digital analytics and an opportunity to work with some of the most data-sophisticated companies in the world. Snowplow is at the cutting edge of how digital analytics and this role is opportunity help us shape how the industry is changing

*What we are looking for in a candidate:*

*You love working with data and are excited to learn new tools and technologies.

*You're self-motivated and prefer to learn by doing, failing, and trying again (often with minimal direction).

*You're a clear thinker who is comfortable explaining her or his thinking, discussing and challenging different approaches, and working collaboratively and creatively to identify new approaches.

*You're a good communicator. You need to be able to work directly with data analysts, data scientists, engineers, product managers, marketers, and management–both at the client and internally at Snowplow. Being able to communicate with clarity and precision, and being responsive to feedback, is as important as your technical ability.

*You have a strong analytical background (BSc or MSc in Maths, Engineering, Economics, Philosophy, ...).

*You have strong technical skills. You need to be proficient at performing data analysis in spreadsheets or any kind of programmatic analysis tool. Prior experience with SQL or any programming language is valuable but not necessary.

*You're interested in how businesses operate. You'll be working with data to solve actual business problems our clients have.

*You have a mature attitude to security, documentation and process. Our clients trust us with their data. This is a huge responsibility and informs everything we do.

*You are able and willing to travel for work (up to 25% of the time).

We are open to people applying directly from university and candidates with 1 to 3 years experience.

*What we offer in return:*

*A competitive package
*25 days of holiday a year (plus bank holidays)
*Freedom to work wherever suits you best
*Two fantastic company away-weeks a year
*Work alongside a strong and talented team

London-specific:

*Convenient location in central London (Shoreditch)
*Continuous supply of Pact coffee
*Regular events with the team

We are looking for candidates to start immediately, but are flexible and happy to work around candidate requirements and desires.

items.title: Senior Systems Administrator (HPC) - Medical Science & Computing, Inc. - Work at Home
items.content:
Senior Systems Administrator (HPC)
Medical Science & Computing, Inc. -Work at Home
Full-time, Other
Medical Science & Computing (MSC) is an exciting growth oriented company, dedicated to providing mission critical scientific and technical services to the Federal Government. We have a distinguished history of supporting the National Institutes of Health (NIH) and other government agencies. MSC offers a dynamic and upbeat work environment, excellent benefits and career growth opportunities.

We attract the best people in the business with our competitive benefits package that includes medical, dental and vision coverage, 401k plan with employer contribution, paid holidays, vacation, Medical and Flexible Spending Accounts, Pre-Tax Transit Assistance and tuition reimbursement. If you enjoy being a part of a high performing, professional service and technology focused organization, please apply today!

MSC is currently searching for a High Performance Computing (HPC) Senior System Administrator to support the Department of Commerce. The successful candidate will be responsible for effective and efficient operations, including maintenance and administration of all UNIX and Windows-based computer systems. This opportunity is slated to be full-time, virtual (telecommute), supporting multiple project sites across the US.

Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Under general direction responsible for activities related to system administration.
  • Assigns personnel to various projects, directs their activities, and evaluates their work.
  • Ensures long-term requirements of systems operations and administration
  • Responsible for the installation, maintenance, configuration, and integrity of computer software
  • Implements operating system enhancements which improve reliability and performance
  • Establish system parameters and formats to ensure hardware/software compatibility
  • Coordinate and/or modify project requirements for existing and projected computer capacity and capabilities.
  • Evaluate, test and validate new releases and variations of system configurations; analyzing and adjusting UNIX/LINUX and Windows servers for performance and efficient operation; while maintaining a high level of optimization on an ongoing basis; along with developing and implementing system monitoring procedures.
  • Troubleshoot hardware and software problems.
  • Routine system administration of UNIX/LINUX and Windows systems.
  • Apply system patches and perform vulnerabilities management.
  • Configure and maintain UNIX /LINUX and Windows system integration; Network File Sharing between UNIX/LINUX and Windows environments.
  • Build software distributions for Windows and UNIX/LINUX operating systems.
  • Install and configure software applications.
  • Backup, archival and storage administration.
  • Create and update procedure documents.
  • Shell/script/Perl/Expect programming for systems when necessary
Position Requirements:
  • Hands-on expertise along with debugging in Red Hat LINUX / CentOS / Solaris system administration.
  • Proficiency with Linux system security and patch management.
  • Strong working knowledge of High Performance Computing (HPC) Tape Libraries, SAN Storage Solutions, such as NAS appliances such as NETAPPs and Dell are required.
  • Experience in administering systems in a networked environment.
  • Experience with MS Hyper-V and/or VMware.
  • Ability to both take direction and work in a self-directed environment; to effectively interact with all levels of staff and external contacts; and ability to work, as an effective team member is essential.
  • Excellent organization, time management skills and flexibility to handle a variety of tasks with the ability to shift priorities simultaneously.
  • Excellent team skills, interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills.
Desired Technical Skills:
  • Knowledge of High Performance Computing (HPC) / Supercomputing / Cluster Environment Infrastructure
  • Knowledge of HPC Hardware from vendors including Cray, IBM, Dell, etc.
  • Knowledge of LAN, WAN, and TCP/IP, SMTP, POP/IMAP protocols.
  • Proficiency in DNS, NFS, NIS, Active Directory, LDAP.
  • Database administration skills in Oracle, MySQL, Microsoft SQL.
  • Experience in writing batch scripting using python / perl / java / bash / expect
  • Intimate knowledge in IP Table and SELinux.
  • RedHat Linux certification and/or Microsoft MCSE.
  • Experience with customer relations and support.
  • Experience in IT team management.
Experience:
  • 5+ years of systems administration experience (preferably in HPC environment)
  • Bachelors' degree (preferred in computer science, IT, or a related field).
Medical Science & Computing, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity /Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

items.title: Science and Technology Writer (Fluent French)
items.content:
(IMMEDIATE HIRE - CAN BE LOCATED IN LONDON OR ANYWHERE IN EUROPE)

We're looking for a new team member to help tech founders win grants and become the next Airbnb or Google ;) You’ll get to work with top founders and their cutting edge technology. The team offers competitive pay and you can make large bonuses.

This is a full-time position that can be based either in London or remotely. We're only looking for full-time team members.

PLEASE BE FLUENT IN WRITTEN FRENCH AND HAVE EXPERIENCE WRITING ABOUT SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY IN FRENCH

Who are you?

-Experience writing in French about science and technology.
-Nerdy in a science tech way. It's nice if you have been a practitioner but not required.
-Able to organize own work process
-Like working on a few interesting tasks in the same day
-Love to write and good at it
-Fluent in French (I know - we've mentioned that a few times;)
-Enjoy working on an awesome team

F6S' global mission is to make the world a better place for tech founders. We think we're winning. We have an global team that starts many days with a fun quiz, takes turns doing standup in team meetings and is leading the growth of the tech economy, in the UK and globally.

-Join a team that is helping millions of tech founders change the world
-Awesome people, awesome atmosphere
-Whole company trips (last trip was to Brazil)
-Company lunches and tech provided
